DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Vorasidenib citrate works by entering the brain and blocking the activity of abnormal IDH1 and IDH2 enzymes produced by IDH1 and IDH2 genes with certain mutations. By blocking these enzymes, vorasidenib citrate helps slow or stop the growth of certain types of brain tumors. It is a small-molecule drug (a drug that can enter cells easily).

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Vorasidenib citrate is approved to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: astrocytoma or oligodendroglioma in adults and children aged 12 years and older that is grade 2, has an abnormal IDH1 or IDH2 gene, and has been treated with surgery, including biopsy, to partially or completely remove the tumor.

Section.Para: Vorasidenib citrate is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
